title: Who left Strictly Come Dancing last night in the fourth elimination?
text:
Strictly Come Dancing just lost another celebrity (Picture: BBC)

Strictly Come Dancing lost its fourth couple over the weekend as one more celebrity hung up their dancing shoes for good.

Saturday night’s show saw Alfonso Ribeiro step in for the absent Bruno Tonioli, a sensational spot of salsa from Karim and Amy, and a new couple at the top of the leaderboard.

But who danced their last this week – and who was saved by the judges?

Here’s what happened on Sunday night’s show…

Who left Strictly Come Dancing last night?

David James’ time on the dancefloor was over (Picture: BBC)

Sunday night’s show saw David James become the fourth celebrity dancer to be eliminated this year.

The former England goalkeeper, who partnered Nadiya Bychkova on the show, had already been in the bottom two twice – being saved by the judges both times – but saw a reversal in his fortunes last week when he was praised for his quickstep.

Advertisement

Advertisement

This week, however, he slid back down to the bottom of the scoreboard as he and Nadiya took on the jive – and this time was voted out after landing in the dance-off alongside Mike Bushell and Katya Jones.

All four of the judges voted to save Mike and Katya, with Craig Revel Horwood saying: ‘Well for me both couples were pretty much technically equal but the couple who I’d like to save were the most confident performers and that was Mike and Katya.’

Meanwhile Alfonso Ribeiro told them: ‘The couple who I’m going to save put on a great show. The technique wasn’t there but they came out and delivered a showstopper for the audience to love so I’m going to save Mike and Katya.’

Afterwards David said of his time on the show: ‘Oh I’ve loved it. I feel so bad I’ve let Nadiya down in a sense.

‘I’ve enjoyed it but I’ve put some weight on though,’ he added,’ going on to reveal that his highlights were ‘having the best partner and the guys up there. Everyone’s lovely. Just a word to Will: I work hard but, man, that guy puts a shift in.

Nadiya told him: ‘He’s done so well. I’m so proud of you. From the first day he couldn’t lift his elbows up or stand straight and now he’s delivered such an amazing jive. I’m so proud.’

The show now has 11 couples remaining, with Halloween week looming next weekend.

Strictly Come Dancing continues next Saturday night on BBC One at 6.35pm.

description: Strictly Come Dancing just bid farewell to the fourth celebrity couple this series - but who was it who left?
